I feel like things are getting out of control.  My mind is going a mile a minute.  Everything from what's my ex boyfriend up to these days to I have to put laundry away.  I feel like out of control.  I don't know why.  I feel like a bad mom, in fact I know I'm a bad mom.  Today they watched TV all day while I read a book.  All. Day.  I made them lunch, but it took them nagging me for a half hour to do it.  I love them dearly, but I just didn't want to be here today.  Rick's been taking my car to work becaue his license plate sticker is expired, so until we can cough up the $100 to replace it, I'm out a car.  So we had to walk to the store today just to get milk.  And that was a chore.  I just didn't want to be anything really.  I took them out to eat while we were out walking, and once we got there, I gave them quarters to go play games just so I wouldn't have to deal with them.  Why is this?  Why am I so aggravated lately?  Maybe it's stress.  We have no money, we never do.  It's not like it's because we're caught up on bills.  I don't think there's ever been a time where we have been.

Maybe it's because I'm 30?  Sounds crazy.  I so badly want to be that mom that gets up at 6, does laundry and dishes and all of the housework and bill paying while the kids are still asleep.  Then they get up and we dine on pancakes and eggs for breakfast, and off to the park.  Then we have lunch, clean up and go outside to play.  Come in for dinner, then bath, and read some books quietly on the couch until it's time to peacefully go to sleep.  In reality, I get up when the kids jump on me in the morning.  The house is trashed, they didn't even get breakfast today because we had no damn milk.  I made lunch at 1:00 and they watched TV all day because it rained.  That's until Jack was annoying Kyle and Kyle deliberately tripped him as he ran away, making Jack fall and hit the wall.  Crying hysteria ensued and I made Kyle sit in his room for 2 hours.  2 hours!  What the hell is wrong with me?  2 hours is ridiculous, but I didn't care.  That boys presses every button imaginable, then somehow finds more.  He's mean.  He's a smart ass.  He's ignorant to me, to Rick, and especially Jack.  Why?  Why must he keep it up?  God help me in 5 years when he's a teenager.

I want to get out of the house for something other than work.  I honest to God cannot tell you the last time Rick and I went out.  That's how long it's been.  I hear moms say this all the time, but they laugh.  I'm not laughing, I really don't know when the last time was.  I want to date again.  I want to go out somewhere, anywhere.  But, of course we can't do that, one of us is always working.  Always gone.  He didn't even come home between jobs tonight.  And is it worth it?  No.  We never have money.  All this bullshit, and we're still broke.  Never together as a family, and for what.  When we are home, on Sunday mornings, Rick sleeps because he's so tired from working 70 hours a week he can't get up.

I don't know where I'm going with this, but it felt good to get that little bit off my chest.  Believe me, there's more.  But I need to go lay down.

So I've been telling Rick for approximately 6 months that I think something's wrong with the plumbing.  Does he listen?  No, come on, does any man?  About 2-3 months ago, whenever I ran water for a long time, like doing dishes or laundry....everyday by the way.....it would smell like rotten eggs in the house.  I even went online and googled this problem, and it mentioned something about the hot water heater.  Made sense to me, I use a lot of hot water, and that was when it seemed the worst.  Fast forward to about 3 weeks ago, all of a sudden when you flushed the toilet, you could hear pressure and gurgling in the kitchen sink.  Now I know we're all cringing, but I assure you, no sewage of any sort was bubbling up anywhere.  I tell Rick again, and nothing.  Finally, I call the neighbor who does sewer things for a living...why would you want to do that....anyhoo, he came today and after about an hour of rodding, it's finally fixed.  I can't believe what a difference this made.  Good lord!  My house does not smell.  I feel like running water all night long.  I've been having a laundry party since about 8 tonight...LOL.

It's the little things, like cleaning shit and globs of dirt out of a sewer that excite me these days. Seeing as the access to the sewer is embedded in my flower bed, my flowers that have yet to be planted have some amazing fertilizer already.  That's a plus right?

So that's done.  All we need to do it replace the faucet in the kitchen and we're good to re-list the house on May 1st.  This time, it's selling, and we'll be in AZ in no time.
